article.title: A quantum-mechanical perspective on linear response theory within polarizable embedding

multiple_choice_question.text: Which panel of Figure 3 illustrates the isotropic electric dipole-dipole polarizability using the nonsymmetric decomposition (NSD)?
Figure 4 illustrates the symmetric subsystem contributions to which component of the electric dipole-dipole polarizability?
What effect does the zero-frequency approximation have on the excitation energies of the pNA-water complex, as illustrated in the inset of Figure 5?
choices: Has no effect on the excitation energies.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 6a, what is the significance of the green solid line taking on negative values around ω ≈ 0.35 a.u.?
choices: Represents a negative absorption cross section for subsystem A.
Indicates intensity borrowing from subsystem B to subsystem A.
Shows the unphysical zeroth-order poles in the nonsymmetric decomposition.
Illustrates the breakdown of the dipole approximation.

multiple_choice_question.text: Equation (31) represents which type of subsystem decomposition of the linear response function?
What is a key feature of the nonsymmetric decomposition of the linear response function presented in Equation (42)?
choices: It treats subsystems on an equal footing.
It places all physical poles in the first term.
It results in fully symmetric subsystem polarizability tensors.

What does Equation (78) define in the context of the polarizable embedding (PE) model?
